balancing automatically distributes your application traffic to multiple targets
the targets that we support today are easy to instances containers and IP

look at some of the advantages of using elastic load balancing on an elastic
load balancer the monitor whole lot of metrics like the throughput the CPU
utilization the memory utilization on your instances and we dynamically scale

so you can focus on building the awesome applications integration elastic load
balancing is integrated with more than 14 other AWS services whether it's route
53 for DNS cloud watch for your metrics
AWS config and lot of other services let's talk about the cost-effectiveness

this is what we recommend your you built your application you've launched it behind an elastic load balancer on

other healthy instances if this traffic spikes and you've enabled auto scaling

introduction of application load balancer and network load balancer we are starting to talk to our customers
about the types of load balancers in general this is very basic right so for
those of you who have familiar with the OSI layer basically there are two types of load balancers a layer four and the
layer seven going by the same OSI naming convention the layer four load balancer
as the name says runs at the layer floor it supports TCP and some load balancers
also support UDP the incoming client connection is just attached to the
server connection the connections are not terminated no headers are modified some load balancers preserve the source
IP but generally the source IP is not preserved some load balancers preserved the source IP by prepending it to a
proxy protocol v2 header which is a definition that h a proxy came up with the layer seven load balancer is
basically an HTTP or HTTPS load balancer functioning at the layer seven here your
client connections are terminated on the load balancer and connected to the backends using a pool of connection
based on the routing features that you've configured on the load balancers the headers might be modified and
usually the client IP is preserved in the x-forwarded-for header so if you
look at we've looked at the basic types of load balancers and coming to the load balancing family we support both layer 4
and layer 7 load balancers application load balancer operating at a request
level terminates your TLS supporting HTTP HTTPS traffic well-suited for your
service mesh architectures and container architectures the layer 4 load balancer
is a network load balancer which functions at layer 4 suitable for high
throughput and can support millions of requests per second the classic load
balancer which is something that we've been had around for a few years supports both layer 4 and layer 7 but
it's not feature-rich let's dive into the application load
balancer application load balancer is a feature-rich layer 7 load balancer that we introduced two years ago so high
level if you want to look at the features of the application load balancer basically a layer 7 load
balancer has a lot of content base features whether it's path based routing
or hostname based routing well-suited for your container applications I'll
walk you through the details on why it is suited for container applications so
we support WebSockets for your full duplex communications whether it's Twitter feeds or for speeds where your

what slow start does is it actually allows the targets to vom and only when

configure what percentage of traffic can go to that newly added target right it's
